input.description:
String Value - The name of a configuration item defined in a configuration module.
Example: BMC_ARS_System, HP_ServiceCenter,BMC_Remedyforce

String Value - The change ID
Remedy Example: CRQ000000000201
HP ServiceCenter Example: C23
BMC_Remedyforce Example :CR00000067

String Value - The new status
BMC_AR_System
Valid Values:
Draft Request For Authorization Request For Change Planning In Progress Scheduled For Review Scheduled For Approval Scheduled Implementation In Progress Pending Rejected Completed Cancelled
HP_ServiceCenter
Valid Values:
Initial Pending Closed
BMC_Remedyforce Valid Values:
Accepted Active Analyzed Approved Archived Assigned Broken Down Closed /No contact Completed Closed Cancelled Development Disabled Discontinued Draft failed In Progress In Stock Installed Known Error Lost or Stolen Maintenance No Resolution Off Line On Loan Waiting for

String Value - Status reason
BMC_AR_System
Valid Values:
No Longer Required Funding Not Available To Be Re-Scheduled Resources Not Available Successful Successful with Issuesl Unsuccessful Backed Out Final Review Complete Final Review Required Additional Coding Required Insufficient Task Data In Verification In Rollout In Sufficient Charge Data Scheddule Conflicts In Development In Test In Build In Rollbaack In Documentation Vendor Purchase Support Group Commmunication Task Review Miscellaneous Future Enhancement Manager Intervention Accepted Assigned Built On Hold Automatically Closed
HP_ServiceCenter
Valid Values:
This is a free form text field to record comments on the closure of this change.
BMC_Remedyforce : Not supported

String Value - actual start date
Remedy Example: 1262304060 (epoch)
HP_ServiceCenter Example: 2009.11.01 08:00:00
BMC_Remedyforce Example : 2012-08-05T13:15:30Z (utc)

String Value - actual end date
Remedy Example: 1262304060 (epoch)
HP_ServiceCenter Example: 2009.11.01 08:00:00
BMC_Remedyforce Example : 2012-08-05T13:15:30Z (utc)

String Value - scheduled start date
Remedy Example: 1262304060 (epoch)
HP_ServiceCenter Example: 2009.11.01 08:00:00
BMC_Remedyforce Example : 2012-08-05T13:15:30Z (utc)

String Value - scheduled end date
Remedy Example: 1262304060 (epoch)
HP_ServiceCenter Example: 2009.11.01 08:00:00
BMC_Remedyforce Example : 2012-08-05T13:15:30Z (utc)

output.description: An XML document providing the data template for single or multiple Concept elements.The change concept is an XML document containing specific elements used to assign multiple values to a single context item. Each value is associated with an element of the Concept.

String Value - Indicates whether or not the process completed successfully.
Valid values: success, failure
String Value - A process specific string that explains the value of success status.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" cdata-section-elements="location" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <Changes> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length(//change) > 0"> <xsl:copy-of select="//change" /> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise>${change}</xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </Changes> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: This workflow tests updating the status of an exisiting change record.
